lines.text: [Rick has narrowly escaped by climbing a fence after being chased by a squad car]
Hey, that was pretty good. You guys are getting a lot faster.
[as punishment for his bad behaviour, Rick's mother is forcing him to clean out the gorilla cage. She hands him a mop]
Your hours are four to six, Monday through Friday. If you do better at school, and if you show some responsibility, we'll forget about military school. If not...
There's gotta be a law or something against this!
She thinks, she feels things. I mean, if we don't help her, who will?
[Katie is being displayed in a department store window]

[signing to Katie what he is saying]
I want you out too.

[surprised]
You can talk to her.
[Rick places his hand on the glass]
She doesn't belong in there.

[shouting]
Couple of guys looking for adventure!
Yes Katie, I know there's a train coming, thank you!
[while running through a forest, Rick trips and falls. A farmer with a shotgun approaches him]
Call that gorilla back here. Do what I say, boy.
Sorry. No can do.
I want that ape!
[Behind them, Katie roars loudly]
[Rick hands Katie a can of soda. She starts to shake it]

[annoyed; signing to Katie what he is saying]
Whoa, whoa, whoa! What did I say about doin' that?
[Katie signs something back]
Right. Not in the van. And where are you now?
[She responds with a sign]
Right again. In the van. Look. Just wait a while before you open that thing, okay?
[Katie seems to understand]
Look the way I see it, we're about a day away from Lacey's uncle's house.
[Katie continues to handle the can. It bursts and Rick is covered with soda]
That wasn't long enough!

[annoyed]
I can't believe I'm wrestling a gorilla for my dinner!

[stares furiously at Bob]
Lou, the dog just peed on my pants!

[looks at the dog]
Bad dog!
Uh...
[makes a contrary gesture]
Good dog!
Uncle Max just called.
[rubs his head]
Oh, Uncle Max...!

[sees Rick playing with Katie]
What on Earth do you think you're doing?
Just fooling around.
[Katie pushes him, Rick pushes back]

[Katie has broken a mirror]
Maybe she's having a bad hair day.

[has just picked up her son at the police station]
Next time I'm not gonna pick you up. How about I let them keep you there for a few days. I'd get some peace!
Are all these bananas for you?
No. They're also for a friend.
Who's that?
[stares at the silhouette of Katie beeping the car horn five times]
Oh that's my brother, sir. He's a musician.
I don't like you. You stay away from my daughter. You understand?
